body.p:
Hawesville Sept 21st 1861
To his Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of Ky & Commander in Chief of the forces of Ky.

The members of the Hancock Rifle Company K. S. G. on the 2d Saturday in July 1861 at their Company meeting after the reading of the General Order No 4, refused to take the oath required by the second section of an act entitled "an act to amend an act for the better organization of the militia approved May 24th 1861 and the Company having thereby become disbanded I have the honor to tender to your Excellency this my resignation of the officer of Captain of said Company.

I have the honor to be your
Excelencys obidient Servant
W W Badger.

Recommended to be accepted
By Order
Genl. T. L. Crittenden
by Geo. W. Monroe
A. D. Camps
124.01

accepted
B. Magoffin
Com in Chief-
